name: Trouva
slogan: the marketplace for independent boutiques and Europe’s top e-commerce startup
description: We are proud to be a tech start-up building the offline to online platform for bricks and mortar shops, handling inventory management, merchandising, AI-led recommendations, and logistics, to offer an even better service than the online giants - with instant click & collect, worldwide shipping and 1 hour delivery (our quickest was in just 22 minutes!).

jobs.title: Performance Marketing Executive
jobs.description:
We are searching for a bright, self-motivated Performance Marketing executive to join our team. Whether you’re a digital addict, data obsessed, or just passionate about ecommerce marketing we’d really like to hear from you!

What you'll do:

* This is a hands-on role where you will be managing and optimizing the Trouva shopping campaigns globally across Google, Bing and other channels as appropriate.
* Maintain and handle merchant center feed using feed management tool
* Continue optimizing merchant center feed using test & learn approach
* Routinely analyse,review and report campaign performance
* Identify opportunity areas for growth and optimisation.
* Work closely with other digital marketing team members to ensure all media is aligned with the business objectives.
* Work closely with other parts of the business to provide digital support and advice
* Develop and maintain essential knowledge by reading relevant industry journals, attending courses, conferences and exhibitions as required.
* Test new initiatives and channels and be consistently pushing the boundaries
* Manage relationship with vendors, marketing partners, and internal stakeholders.

jobs.title: Senior B2B Comms & Events
jobs.description:
We’re looking for an experienced B2B comms and events specialist to engage, educate and delight our Community of independent boutiques. A master of messaging and form across all channels, you’ll plan out and deliver an exceptional communications strategy that elevates us in their minds and in their hearts. Alongside this, you’ll deliver a programme of events that our shops simply cannot (and will not) miss.

What you’ll do

* Own all our channels of B2B communication from weekly email newsletters, to highly targeted push notifications, to compelling lead re-engagement campaigns and everything in between
* Create great content that (i) attracts handpicked boutiques to join Trouva; (ii) keeps our Community abreast of business-critical initiatives and company developments (iii) inspires and enables our shops to realise their commercial potential
* Maintain our growing database of shop contacts and ensure all info is kept up-to-date
* Constantly track, analyse and optimise all of our communication channels to make sure the shops are receiving, appreciating and heeding our messages
* Plan and deliver (with event organiser resource where relevant) a compelling events programme, from small monthly regional educational events to our renowned Annual Global Independent Boutique Awards
* Manage and develop our mutual relationships with top trade shows from Top Drawer in London, to Maison et Objet in Paris and beyond
* Own our shop-facing guide to everything Trouva; make it relevant, make it useful, make it usable and keep it that way in a fast-changing environment
* Collate relevant information from teams around the business and be the gatekeeper for what gets communicated externally and when
* Ensure that as our international Community of shops grows, relevant comms is translated and distributed in just as effective a way to this portfolio, with the help of our in-market Community teams
* Develop or formalise new channels of communication with our boutiques whether this be a boutique forum, instagram, social media platforms or other novel ways to get our points across
* Listen to boutique feedback and use it to continually improve

jobs.title: Senior Digital Designer
jobs.description:
Trouva is the leading online marketplace for independent boutiques and one of Europe’s top e-commerce startups. Our vision? A thriving global community of independent shops and shoppers united by their passion for unique products for the home. Trouva is backed by BGF Ventures, the UK’s largest venture fund, alongside Index Ventures (Europe’s largest VC fund and investors in Farfetch, ASOS and Etsy) and Octopus Investments (backers of Secret Escapes and Graze). It is one of the five fastest growing tech businesses in the UK (TNW Tech5) and was named one of Wired’s hottest startups in London.

We are looking for an outstanding Senior Digital Designer to work on Trouva’s graphic design across all platforms. You will be producing artwork for the website, social channels, emails and offline projects when relevant. Being part of our in-house team you will report into the Creative Brand Director and play a part in shaping the aesthetic of the Trouva brand as it evolves, working in an extraordinarily fast paced, start-up environment.

You’ll be working on a wide range of exciting projects so a breadth of design knowledge is essential and, as we’re a online brand, solid e-commerce experience is crucial. We are looking for someone who can deliver exceptional work that inspires our customer to purchase and makes them loyal and excited about our brand. You need to be able to think commercially and have an entrepreneurial approach in the way you work.

What you will do:
* Develop campaign concepts alongside the Creative Brand Director
* Work within the Brand Marketing team to produce on brand, engaging content of the highest standard with our customer front of mind for a wide range of online and when relevant offline channels
* Partner with internal teams across the company on graphic briefs. Develop innovative ideas in response to their needs resulting in the production of high quality content
* Design and update on site content on a regular basis using the CMS
* Create landing pages to support marketing content campaigns
* Support wider marketing team creating visuals for paid social channels, email and digital display adverts
* Scope out design initiatives and juggle multiple projects, proactively managing your own time

Who you are:
* 5+ years relevant industry experience
* A strong portfolio of relevant digital, creative work, ideally in interiors, design or fashion e-commerce
* Proven experience in digital / social campaigns
* In-depth use of the Adobe Creative Suite
* Expert in HTML 5 and CSS
* Strong understanding of design fundamentals such as typography, colour and layout
* The ability to work independently
* Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills
* Self-motivated, flexible and with impeccable attention to detail
* Bachelor’s degree in design or related field

What you'll get in return:
* Competitive salary and share options in one of the UK’s most exciting startups. Equity is very important to us - we want you to be a shareholder in the company so you are part of the upside if we're successful together
* 33 days including 8 bank holidays per annum
* Company pension
* A beautiful office space in Central London, with unlimited coffee, snacks and fresh fruit
* Need tech or equipment? We'll provide whatever you need to get the job done
* Regular team events where we celebrate our success and people
* Company benefits membership (e.g. discount on Apple products, discounted gym membership, free mobile phone insurance - via Perkbox), unlimited staff discount on all Trouva products and a Trouva gift card to get something awesome for your desk
